item.title: Neglected public right of way, 4th October
item.description:
I live in gossington close and the pathway between beechwood rise and green lane is really neglected. The grass has not been cut for months and when the contractors do cut it it results in weeds as they leave the cuttings on top. The grass needs replacing the pathway weeded. 140 Green Lane fence has been down for over 5 years and I have asked the owner to put a new one up as it looks an eyesore and the struts are dangerous to the public. Can you put an enforcement order for the owner to put up a new fence or is Bromley Borough responsible as it is an eyesore and dangerous to children because of the wood sticking out. Also there are weeds all the way down the pathway which have never been removed by the contractors and they are getting worse and the house on the corner of Beechwood Rise has greenery hanging over on the public right of way. The tarmac path is also damaged.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Garrard Close, Chislehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet
